Ø  **Course description**

This course aims to improve students’ AcademicEnglish proficiency with a strong focus on reading, speaking and writing inAcademic English. In this course, there will be a range of activities whichengage students in contemporary topics with practical issues, sharpen theircritical thinking, and boost their communicative abilities. They also learn toteamwork with their peers and to become more autonomous learners.

Ø  **Course objectives:**

The course is designed to

1)     Develop students’ communicativeskills in Academic English

2)     Expand and enhance students’knowledge of academic vocabulary in Education

3)     Build students’ confidence incommunication in English

4)     Develop students’ teamwork andautonomy

5)     Broaden cultural andintercultural knowledge

Ø  **Classroom materials**

Book chapters and journal articles inEducation, videos on YouTube and some online writing pieces. The full list ofthese materials will be available on September 20.

Ø  Grading policy and course requirements

v  Grading policy

1)     Attendance and participation:10%

2)     Assignments: 20%

3)     Lexile test: 10%

4)     Mid-term test: 20%

5)     Final test: 40%

v  Course requirements:

·        _Attendance and participation (10%)_

Class attendance is required and strictlychecked. Students are expected to come to class every week, except for (a)hospitalized cases; or (b) emergencies; or (c) authorized absences. For theseexceptions, evidence with the signature and stamp of the person in charge mustbe provided. For example, for hospitalized cases, a medical form that provesthe student was hospitalized with the signature of the doctor and/or medicalstaff with his/her stamp must be submitted. Any absences apart from theexceptions mentioned above are counted, and each absence results in 1 point deductedin the attendance/participation score.

·        _Quizzes and Assignments (20%)_

Students are expected to submit their assignmentsbefore the due date. Late submissions will result in 30% deduction in the scorefor quizzes and assignments. A submission which is received 2 days or laterthan due date will be instantly marked zero. If there is an emergency happeningon the due date, students should email the lecturer as soon as possible.In-class quizzes are also required and counted towards the grade.

·        _Lexile test (10%)_

Students are required to take the Lexiletest. This test will place from October 7 to November 8.

·        _Mid-term test (20%) and final test (40%)_

For the mid-term test, students will workin groups of three or four and will present on one of the topics given. Thepresentation must last from 6 to 8 minutes.

For the final test, students will workindividually and will write an essay on one of the topics which was discussedduring the course and which is within the field of Education. Each essay willbe marked on 3 criteria: Topic Development (Task Response), Organization(Coherence and Cohesion), and Delivery (Vocabulary and Grammar). See scoringguide based on [TOEFL iBTIndependent Writing Rubrics](http://www.ets.org/s/toefl/pdf/toefl_writing_rubrics.pdf) (page 1).
